guide.introduction: This guide will cover the basic concept of the Ping))) sensor by making a fun project.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This guide will cover the basic concept of the Ping))) sensor by making a fun project.

Relevant parts
  • Arduino microcontroller
  • Wire
  • LCD screen
  • 10k Pot
  • 8 Ohm mini speaker
  • PING))) Ultrasonic Sensor
  • Small Breadboard
  • headphone jack
  • Resistors, 1kΩ
Tools
  • ProtoShield
  • USB A to B cable

lines.text: Wire backlight according to pins on LCD. Same for logic circuits. Pot wiper goes to Vo (contrast), one outer pin of the pot goes to ground, the other to 5v.
lines.text_raw: Wire backlight according to pins on LCD. Same for logic circuits. Pot wiper goes to Vo (contrast), one outer pin of the pot goes to ground, the other to 5v.

lines.text: Use pot to control contrast to your needs.
lines.text_raw: Use pot to control contrast to your needs.

lines.text: * LCD RS pin to digital pin 12  * LCD Enable pin to digital pin 11  * LCD D4 pin to digital pin 5  * LCD D5 pin to digital pin 4  * LCD D6 pin to digital pin 3  * LCD D7 pin to digital pin 2  * LCD R/W to ground
lines.text_raw: * LCD RS pin to digital pin 12  * LCD Enable pin to digital pin 11  * LCD D4 pin to digital pin 5  * LCD D5 pin to digital pin 4  * LCD D6 pin to digital pin 3  * LCD D7 pin to digital pin 2  * LCD R/W to ground

lines.text: I used a 1K resistor instead of a 10K pot.
lines.text_raw: I used a 1K resistor instead of a 10K pot.

lines.text: Use the 10K pot to control the contrast.
lines.text_raw: Use the 10K pot to control the contrast.

lines.text: Sound is on pin 10 and ping is on pin 7. 1kΩ resistor on headphone ground.
